page.title: 06Coarse Fishing-River Severn
page.content: The River Severn is the third longest river in England.The fish you would catch are eels.The young eels or {elvers}return to the river in spring after swimming many miles. These are a favourite meal,so many are caught.The Severn is a murky river that's why you catch eels mostly.The Severn runs through most parts of Gloucestershire.In some places it's slow and others fast.The river is a busy river because boats are always coming up and down.On the other side there is mostly grass and opposite the boating lake there are the houses of Pool Meadow.We go fishing at 10am and return at 5pm.We take a packed lunch. Before we start to fish we put our tackle on,which is a float or leadger,hooks and for bait we use maggots and worms.We catch mainly {bream and eels.
